meanings.definition: Bealings (noun): the act of bealing or making a loud noise
meanings.sent1: The bealings of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The bealings of the construction work could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: The bealings of the pots and pans in the kitchen sounded like a musical performance.
meanings.sent4: The bealings of the fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.
meanings.sent5: The bealings of the drums echoed through the valley, signaling the start of the festival.

meanings.definition: Bealings (verb): to make a loud noise or commotion
meanings.sent1: The children bealings in the playground could be heard throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The car engine bealings woke up the entire household early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The bealings of the students rushing to their classes created a chaotic scene in the hallway.
meanings.sent4: The bealings of the wind against the windows made it hard to sleep at night.
meanings.sent5: The bealings of the excited crowd filled the stadium with energy during the game.
